description: Erection of single storey side/rear and rear extension
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.	Reason:  As required  by Section 91 of  the Town  and Country Planning  Act  1990,  as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Development  shall  be  carried  out  in  accordance  with  the  materials  specified  on  the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.	Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Written schemes of investigation will need to be prepared and  implemented by a suitably qualifiedprofessionally accredited  archaeological practice in accordance with Historic England's  Guidelines for Archaeological Projects in Greater London. This  condition is exempt from deemed discharge under schedule 6 of The  Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure)  (England) Order 2015.

Written schemes of investigation will need to be prepared and  implemented by a suitably qualifiedprofessionally accredited  archaeological practice in accordance with Historic England's  Guidelines for Archaeological Projects in Greater London. This  condition is exempt from deemed discharge under schedule 6 of The  Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure)  (England) Order 2015.

Please provide existing and proposed plans/elevations at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing the outline of entire  plan, and all key dimensions for the proposed works.Please note that the submitted plan did not show a scale bar/key dimensions.

Please note that you had identified the works being carried on in your property as existing and not proposed, therefore the higher fee of £462 is required, and an additional £231 will need to be paid.
